description:
On a drunken night out to complain about an ex, Minare Koda absentmindedly shares too much information with a stranger from the radio station. The next morning, she’s shocked to hear her voice on the radio. Bursting into the station with intentions to justify her previous night’s rant quickly turns into an interview on-air and the offer to share her chaotic life with an unsuspecting audience!

(Source: Crunchyroll)

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ohkowai/status/1446500402275373056)

Takumi Yokota is an animator and character designer that is currently freelance. He was formerly affiliated with ufotable, Anime International Company (AIC), and Shaft.

After graduating from university from the Faculty of Law department, he joined ufotable as a production assistant. He stated in an interview with Akiba Souken in 2019, that while watching movies and anime at the library in his third or fourth year of job hunting, he fell in love with the work Patlabor: The Mobile Police, directed by Mamoru Oshii. And while watching Oshii's interview, he decided that he wanted to become a director, and when he was researching on how to become a director, he found out that one of the paths of becoming a director is by starting out as a production assistant; and so he applied as a production assistant at ufotable. He later left ufotable due to various reasons and described himself as a NEET for almost half a year after departing from ufotable. After more than three months of being a NEET, he thought to himself that he really needed to get a job, and then remembered his time as a production assistant at ufotable. While still working as a production assistant at ufotable, a conversation with an animator at ufotable stuck with him, and thought subsequently: "Let's go back to anime again!" And in 2007, he applied as an animator at Anime International Company (AIC) when he saw that the studio was hiring 20 new animators, and got the position. He made his debut as an animator with 2007's Tokyo Majin, co-animated by AIC Spirits and BeSTACK. He has stated that while at his time at the studio, AIC took care of its animators well so that they could live, and was occasionally treated by his seniors at the studio. He cites Ryuichi Makino as one of his mentors while at AIC. In 2011, he made his debut as an animation director in 2011, with AIC's adaptation of R-15 of the same name. In 2013, he made his character designer debut with Pupipo!, animated by AIC PLUS+. In 2014, he left AIC and became an animator at Shaft. As of December 2019, he has become freelance.
He is a singer, composer and guitarist.

He has done various illustrations for magazines and EroGuro work. He has an EroGuro book out that is mostly a compilation of some of the work he has created. His favourite bands are Queen, Black Sabbath and Jittarin Jin.

He has a good understanding of anatomy that allows him to create uniquely expressive poses and angles. His use of accurately detailed shots of hands and feet makes them almost as reflective of character and mood as his faces. Atmospheric backgrounds and landscapes round out the look of the manga, which incorporates many panels done in a finished, shaded pencil style rather than in inked line art. His superb drawing skills are shown to their best advantage in these penciled panels. This applies to most of the manga and artwork he has created. He doesn't seem to use pencils as much as he used to though, preferring a sketchy ink style instead.

Samura says that he always wanted to be a manga artist. However, unlike most mangaka, he attended art school for a time and has a classical art education. He disliked oil painting and prefers to work in black and white. He says that he disliked oil painting from the start because of the smell of the paint and employed someone to help himself cheat to get through the course, which he is quite open about in interviews. He never completed the course because he got picked up by Afternoon before he graduated to do Blade of the Immortal.

[Website](https://tacica.jp/) Formed in April of 2005, tacica is a two piece rock band hailing from Sapporo. Members: [Shouichi Igari](https://anilist.co/staff/149251/Shouichi-Igari) - Vocals & Guitar Konishi Yuuta - Bass Sakai Toshihiko - Drums (left the band in 2014)

Christopher Robin Sabat is an American voice actor, producer, ADR director, and line producer at Funimation. He provided voices for a number of English versions of Japanese anime series such as a number of Dragon Ball characters, including Vegeta, Piccolo, Yamcha, and some others. In Funimation's re-dubbing of One Piece, he voices Roronoa Zoro. Other major roles include Kazuma Kuwabara in Yu Yu Hakusho, Alex Louis Armstrong in Fullmetal Alchemist, Tatsumi Saiga in Speed Grapher, Kurogane in Tsubasa Reservoir Chronicle, Daisuke Jigen in Lupin the Third and All Might in My Hero Academia. In video games, he voiced Garland in Dissidia: Final Fantasy, Rundas in Metroid Prime 3: Corruption, Alex D in Deus Ex: Invisible War, and both Captain Smiley and Star in Comic Jumper. He is the founder and director of OkraTron 5000, an audio production company that provides support for some of Funimation's and other dubbing titles.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/marchimark) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/jamiemarchi/)

An American voice actress, ADR director, and script writer who works for Funimation and Sentai Filmworks. She grew up in Oklahoma and graduated from the University of Oklahoma with a bachelor's degree in theater, starting her professional acting career in 2000. She married fellow actor Sean T. Perez on August 8, 1999, and they divorced on November 21, 2005. Jamie has two step-daughters. Her younger half-brother, [Jean-Luc Hester](https://anilist.co/staff/104094), is also a voice actor.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Chom2Start)  |  [SOUL OF JOE (fansite)](http://soulofjoe.jp/index.html)

Currently working for Studio M2.

He's an Ashita no Joe ''collector'' and fan and has contributed to books, TV programs, museums and more. He is also an administrator of the fansite ''SOUL OF JOE''.

Hiroo Maruyama is a producer working for Mainichi Broadcasting System (MBS).

He joined Mainichi Broadcasting in 1999. Was transferred later to the Tokyo office and took over duties relating to the production of animation broadcasts. He was responsible for production on series like Gundam Seed, Gundam Seed Destiny and Full Metal Alchemist, all part of the 6:00pm Saturday timeblock, which gained wide popularity.

He is an art director and supervisor, who was a long time member of Bihou until 2007 when he went to head the background art department in Totonyan. He belongs to the anime production group Neko-Nanban-Tei together with director Watanabe Takashi and his wife Miyata Naomi.
